Comment: > "We don't do much business with Canada, they do more business with us."  Question: Google, who was the largest export market for the US last year  Answer: Canada was the largest export market for the United States. Following Canada, Mexico was the second largest export market, and China was third. These three countries accounted for a significant portion of U.S. exports in 2024, with Canada receiving 16.9% of total exports ($349.4 billion), Mexico receiving 16.2% ($334.0 billion), and China receiving 7% ($143.5 billion)  Jesus Murphy, the nonsense we have to put up with.

Comment: The point is we buy more from America than any country in the world and we're 9 times smaller.   Not good enough? How about this to fix the trade deficit (or subsidization as your knucklehead president keeps referring to it.)   We stop selling America deep discounted crude that you refine which keeps American gas prices down and also allows you to refine your domestic oil to sell on the world market at a great profit and presto there's no more trade deficit.   You now have the trade surplus Trump wants, America gets reduced petroleum profits and more expensive gas prices.
Author: biscuitarse
